Description: Round-topped limestone stela decorated with a palmette above a representation of two lions between pilasters; Greek text around the upper edge.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.135, Pl.97)
Tudor 2011 / Christian Funerary Stelae of the Byzantine and Arab Periods from Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: I.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 97:4 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
